examples: A bit of unground wheat in flour can really hurt when you bite it, another reason to sift.

verbs.description: unground (third-person singular simple present ungrounds, present participle ungrounding, simple past and past participle ungrounded)

entries.meaning: (transitive, electricity, electronics) To remove a connection to ground potential.
examples: If you unground the extension cord it will cause a shock hazard in that drill.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To free from the punishment of being grounded (restricted to home).
examples: We'll consider ungrounding you when you can act your age.
